result.execSummary:
The defendant James J. Greenhill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $ TBD   plus surcharges.  Restitution hearing to be held before Comm Dowse.
Perform  40    hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Eric Scott, unless otherwise permitted by the court.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Proposed Restitution Findings of Fact and Conculusions of Law - Court determined restitution to be awarded to the victim in the amount of $0.00.

914 Clerk HM.   Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appears with Attorney Kmiec.  Victim E.S. appears by phone pro se (incarcerated).    State advises court that VI is seeking restitution in the amt of $35,000 for loss of employment.    Victim sworn in and testified.   VI states he is also seeking restitution for mental health issues, pain and suffering and dental work.  State advises VI that he is not able to receive restitution for pain/suffering.    VI has not provided any bills/docs to allow state to identify expenses.    VI states he does not have any ducumentation available to him.    Atty Kmiec not noticed on additional restitution.   Atty Kmiec moves for directed finding denying restitution.   State has complied with victim rights, but has nothing further to offer due to lack of documentation.   Court sets restitution at zero.  Court will prepare order.
ADDRESS INFO for victim party not available
VI's NOH for 10/16 RSH returned UTF.
Restitution hearing at 10-16-2015 09:00 am
Sent to Rm 300 for  scheduling of restitution hearing.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, James J. Greenhill, appeared with Attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec Iii.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.   As a condition court imposes 21 days in the KCJ commencing on 9/26/15 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew privileges authorized.  DE is also ordered to complete 40 hrs of community service.  No contact with Eric S. unless permitted by the court.   Restitution is not stipulated to by parties and restitution shall be determined through a Restitution  Hearing before Comm. Dowse.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, James J. Greenhill, appeared.  Clerk: PT
Court received email correspondence and Atty Kmiec thought hearing was tomorrow and is in Rock Co. today.  Court sets sentencing over to tomorrow and arrangements were made for victim to appear from Stanley Correction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.

It was requested that Victim, Eric Scott appear by video conference at sentencing. Efforts were made and video conf. is not available at that time so victim will appear by phone from Stanley Correctional.
Amended Info

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, James J. Greenhill, appeared with Attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec Iii.  Clerk: PT
Amended Information filed by the State and case is resolved.  Counts 1 & 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Parties request sentencing be adjourned for victim rights compliance.  Sentencing on 9/9/15 at 10:30 AM.
Per email correspondence received from Atty Kmiec case is resolved so there will be no appearance for the Jury Status on 7/9/15.  Case will be settled with a plea on Monday, 7/13/15 at 8:30 AM.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, James J. Greenhill, appeared with Attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec Iii.  Clerk: PT
Upon hearing arguments made by parties motion is denied.  Case remains on for trial as previously scheduled.
